001.name: النفايات العضوية
001.description: تأتي النفايات العضوية بشكل رئيسي من المطابخ والحدائق. تشمل المواد القابلة للتحلل مثل فضلات الطعام ونفايات الحديقة والألياف الطبيعية. غنية بالمغذيات، هذه المواد مثالية للتسميد، الذي يحول النفايات إلى محسنات التربة القيمة.

guideLines.recommendedBinType: صندوق السماد (مهوى)، معدن أو بلاستيك متين، أخضر/بني
guideLines.handling: استخدم القفازات عند التعامل، اغسل يديك بعد التخلص. تجنب الاتصال المباشر بالمواد المتحللة.
guideLines.separation: افصل المواد العضوية عن العناصر غير العضوية (مثل البلاستيك والمعادن والزجاج) لضمان التسميد الفعال.
guideLines.whatNotToDo: لا تتضمن المواد غير العضوية مثل البلاستيك والمعادن أو الزجاج. تجنب التخلص من المنتجات المعالجة كيميائياً أو المواد الملوثة بالزيت/الشحوم.
guideLines.safetyPrecautions: استخدم القفازات عند التعامل مع النفايات العضوية لتجنب الاتصال المباشر بالمواد المتحللة والمسببات المحتملة للأمراض. تأكد من أن منطقة التسميد جيدة التهوية لمنع تراكم الروائح الكريهة. اغسل يديك جيدًا بعد التعامل مع المواد العضوية للحفاظ على النظافة الشخصية.

whyItIsImportant.benefits: يقلل من استخدام مكبات النفايات وانبعاثات الميثان، ويقلل من الحاجة إلى الأسمدة الكيماوية. يعزز الزراعة المستدامة.
whyItIsImportant.impact: يحول النفايات إلى سماد قيم، مما يثري التربة بالمغذيات ويدعم نمو النباتات الصحي. يشجع على استخدام الأرض المستدام.

001.funFact: إذا تم تسميدها، يمكن للنفايات الغذائية السنوية العالمية أن تقلل من الانبعاثات المكافئة لثاني أكسيد الكربون لـ 2 مليار سيارة خارج الطريق، وهو أكثر من إجمالي عدد السيارات التي تُقاد في العالم.

002.name: نفايات زراعية
002.description: تشمل النفايات الزراعية كلاً من المواد العضوية وغير العضوية من الأنشطة الزراعية. وهذا يشمل المنتجات الطبيعية الثانوية مثل بقايا المحاصيل والسماد، فضلاً عن النفايات غير العضوية مثل الحاويات والبلاستيك والآلات القديمة. الإدارة الفعالة ضرورية للحد من التأثير البيئي ودعم الزراعة المستدامة.

guideLines.recommendedBinType: حاويات متخصصة للنفايات العضوية وغير العضوية، مع معالجة منفصلة للمواد الخطرة
guideLines.handling: استخدم معدات الحماية للعناصر الخطرة. قم بتسميد النفايات العضوية حيثما ينطبق ذلك.
guideLines.separation: افصل المواد العضوية عن النفايات الكيميائية والبلاستيكية. تعامل مع المواد الخطرة بعناية.
guideLines.whatNotToDo: لا تحرق البلاستيك أو حاويات المواد الكيميائية. تجنب خلط النفايات العضوية مع المواد الخطرة.
guideLines.safetyPrecautions: ارتدي القفازات والملابس الواقية، خاصةً عند التعامل مع الأسمدة الكيميائية أو المبيدات. تأكد من التهوية الجيدة عند العمل مع تعديلات التربة أو في أماكن مغلقة مثل البيوت الزجاجية.

whyItIsImportant.benefits: التخلص السليم يقلل من التلوث، ويعزز صحة التربة، ويعزز الممارسات المستدامة.
whyItIsImportant.impact: إدارة النفايات الزراعية بفعالية تقلل البصمة البيئية للزراعة وتحافظ على الموارد، مع دعم الممارسات الزراعية المستدامة.

002.funFact: إذا تم إدارتها وتسميدها بشكل صحيح، يمكن لبقايا المحاصيل أن تثري خصوبة التربة بشكل كبير، مما يقلل من الحاجة إلى الأسمدة الاصطناعية.

003.name: نفايات الحيوانات
003.description: تشير نفايات الحيوانات إلى المنتجات الثانوية الناتجة عن تربية المواشي والدواجن وغيرها من أنشطة تربية الحيوانات. وتشمل النفايات العضوية مثل السماد والتبن، بالإضافة إلى الذبائح والمنتجات المشتقة من الحيوانات والتالفة. التعامل السليم والتخلص منها أمر حاسم لصحة البيئة ولمنع انتشار الأمراض.

guideLines.recommendedBinType: حاويات متخصصة للنفايات الحيوية الخطرة، منفصلة عن النفايات العادية
guideLines.handling: استخدم معدات الحماية، خاصةً عند التعامل مع الذبائح أو النفايات الملوثة. اتبع بروتوكولات النظافة الصارمة.
guideLines.separation: افصل نفايات الحيوانات الحيوية الخطرة عن النفايات العادية. تخلص منها في حاويات مخصصة.
guideLines.whatNotToDo: لا تخلطها مع النفايات العامة. تجنب الاتصال المباشر بدون معدات السلامة المناسبة.
guideLines.safetyPrecautions: ارتدِ قفازات وأحذية واقية عند التعامل مع نفايات الحيوانات لمنع الاتصال المباشر مع الكائنات الدقيقة الضارة. تأكد من تهوية جيدة في المناطق التي يتم فيها تخزين أو معالجة نفايات الحيوانات. بعد التعامل مع نفايات الحيوانات، اغسل يديك جيدًا بالصابون والماء لمنع انتشار الأمراض الحيوانية المنشأ.

whyItIsImportant.benefits: الإدارة السليمة تمنع التلوث البيئي والمخاطر الصحية للبشر والحيوانات.
whyItIsImportant.impact: التخلص المسؤول من نفايات الحيوانات يدعم الصحة العامة، وحماية البيئة، وممارسات الزراعة المستدامة.

guideLines.funFact: يمكن للسماد من بقرة واحدة أن يولد كفاية كهرباء لتشغيل ثلاجة صغيرة ليوم واحد، مما يوضح إمكانية تحويل نفايات الحيوانات إلى طاقة متجددة.

004.name: نفايات الطعام
004.description: حاويات نفايات الطعام مخصصة للتخلص من أنواع مختلفة من نفايات الطعام، بما في ذلك البقايا والعناصر منتهية الصلاحية وفضلات الطعام. هذه الفئة من النفايات مناسبة للهضم الحيوي أو التسميد، وتحويل المواد العضوية إلى موارد ذات قيمة.

guideLines.recommendedBinType: حاوية محكمة الإغلاق، مع التحكم في الرائحة، أخضر داكن أو بني
guideLines.handling: أغلق نفايات الطعام للحد من الروائح ومنع الحشرات. اغسل وعقم يديك دائمًا بعد التعامل. نظف التسربات على الفور.
guideLines.separation: افصل نفايات الطعام عن المواد القابلة لإعادة التدوير وغير القابلة للتسميد لتعزيز كفاءة التسميد وإعادة التدوير.
guideLines.whatNotToDo: لا تخلط نفايات الطعام مع السوائل أو الزيوت أو المواد الكيميائية. تجنب إدراج العناصر غير القابلة للتحلل البيولوجي مثل البلاستيك أو المعادن. لا تترك نفايات الطعام مكشوفة لمنع جذب الآفات وتوليد الروائح.
guideLines.safetyPrecautions: ارتدي القفازات والأحذية الواقية عند التعامل مع نفايات الطعام لمنع الاتصال المباشر بالكائنات الدقيقة الضارة. تأكد من أن الأماكن التي يتم فيها تخزين أو معالجة نفايات الطعام جيدة التهوية. اغسل يديك جيدًا بالصابون والماء بعد التعامل مع نفايات الطعام لمنع انتشار الأمراض الحيوانية المنشأ.

whyItIsImportant.benefits: يساعد في منع جذب الآفات، ويقلل من انبعاثات غازات الاحتباس الحراري من مكبات النفايات، ويسهل إنتاج السماد أو الغاز الحيوي.
whyItIsImportant.impact: الإدارة السليمة لنفايات الطعام توفر الموارد، وتقلل من التأثير البيئي، وتعزز الممارسات المستدامة.

004.funFact: إذا كانت نفايات الطعام دولة، فستكون ثالث أكبر مصدر لانبعاثات غازات الدفيئة عالميًا، بعد الولايات المتحدة والصين. تقليل نفايات الطعام أمر حاسم لتقليل التأثير البيئي.

005.name: نفايات خضراء
005.description: تتألف النفايات الخضراء من حطام النباتات والحدائق، وتلعب دورًا حيويًا في إعادة تدوير المواد العضوية. يساهم تحويل النفايات الخضراء إلى سماد في إنشاء تعديلات التربة الغنية بالمغذيات، وهو أمر ضروري للزراعة والبستنة المستدامة.

guideLines.recommendedBinType: حاوية مفتوحة، سعة كبيرة، يفضل أن تكون خضراء
guideLines.handling: استخدم القفازات عند التعامل مع النفايات الخضراء لتجنب القطوع أو التهيج من المواد الخشنة. اغسل يديك بعد التخلص منها.
guideLines.separation: افصل النفايات الخضراء عن النفايات المنزلية والخطرة. لا تخلطها مع نفايات الطعام أو المواد القابلة لإعادة التدوير.
guideLines.whatNotToDo: تجنب التخلص من المواد غير العضوية مثل الأكياس البلاستيكية أو الأواني. لا تشمل التربة أو الصخور. امتنع عن إضافة النباتات المريضة أو الأنواع الغازية التي قد تلوث السماد.

whyItIsImportant.benefits: يسهل إنتاج السماد، ويثري صحة التربة، ويساعد في احتجاز الكربون. يقلل من استخدام مساحة مكب النفايات وانبعاثات غازات الدفيئة.
whyItIsImportant.impact: يساهم في إدارة النفايات المستدامة، ويدعم التنوع البيولوجي في التربة، ويشجع على ممارسات البستنة والزراعة الصديقة للبيئة.

005.funFact: يمكن تحويل النفايات الخضراء مثل قصاصات العشب وأوراق الشجر إلى تربة غنية، والمعروفة باسم 'الذهب الأسود' بين البستانيين، مما يحسن نمو النباتات بدون الأسمدة الكيميائية.

006.name: Recyclable Waste
006.description: Recyclable waste includes a variety of materials that can be reprocessed for further use. Key items in this category include paper products, plastics, glass, metals, and certain types of electronics, all of which play a vital role in resource conservation and environmental sustainability.

guideLines.recommendedBinType: Recycling Bin, Metal or Durable Plastic
guideLines.handling: Ensure items are clean and dry before recycling. Sort them according to local recycling guidelines.
guideLines.separation: Separate different types of recyclables to avoid contamination with non-recyclable materials.
guideLines.whatNotToDo: Avoid including soiled, contaminated, or non-recyclable materials. Adhere to local recycling rules for specific disposals.
guideLines.safetyPrecautions: When handling green waste, like grass clippings and tree branches, wear gloves to protect your hands from scratches and irritants. If using power tools for trimming or cutting, wear appropriate safety gear including goggles and hearing protection. Be cautious of insects or animals that may be living in the green waste material.

whyItIsImportant.benefits: Reduces the need for new raw materials, conserves energy, and lessens the environmental impact of waste.
whyItIsImportant.impact: Supports sustainable resource management, contributing to environmental conservation and protection efforts.

006.funFact: Composting green waste not only reduces landfill use but also creates a nutrient-rich soil amendment. In one year, an average tree absorbs about 48 pounds of CO2, making green waste a valuable resource in combatting climate change.

007.name: Automotive Waste
007.description: Automotive waste encompasses various materials and components discarded from vehicles. It includes both hazardous and non-hazardous waste types, such as oils, batteries, tires, and mechanical parts. Proper disposal and recycling of automotive waste are crucial for environmental protection and resource conservation.

guideLines.recommendedBinType: Specialized containers for hazardous materials, designated areas for larger parts
guideLines.handling: Handle with care, especially for hazardous substances. Use safety gear when dealing with oils and chemicals.
guideLines.separation: Separate hazardous waste like oils and batteries from non-hazardous items. Follow local guidelines for disposal of each type.
guideLines.whatNotToDo: Do not dispose of automotive oils and chemicals in regular trash or drains. Avoid mixing different types of automotive waste.
guideLines.safetyPrecautions: Wear gloves and eye protection when handling automotive waste like used oil, batteries, and tires to prevent contact with hazardous materials. Always work in well-ventilated areas to avoid inhaling fumes, especially when dealing with automotive fluids. Dispose of automotive waste at designated recycling centers to prevent environmental contamination.

whyItIsImportant.benefits: Prevents environmental contamination, conserves valuable materials, and supports recycling initiatives.
whyItIsImportant.impact: Proper management of automotive waste minimizes the ecological footprint of vehicle use and maintenance, contributing to a cleaner and safer environment.

007.funFact: Recycling just one car saves over 2,500 pounds of iron ore, 1,400 pounds of coal, and 120 pounds of limestone. This process also significantly reduces the energy and raw materials needed to produce new automotive parts and vehicles.

008.name: Bulky Waste
008.description: Bulky waste includes large items that cannot fit into regular trash bins. Proper disposal of bulky waste is essential for efficient waste management and environmental preservation. Recycling bulky items can contribute to resource conservation.

guideLines.recommendedBinType: Special Collection or Drop-off Point
guideLines.handling: Check with local waste management for specific disposal instructions. Some items may require special handling or pickup services.
guideLines.separation: Separate different types of bulky items for appropriate recycling or disposal methods.
guideLines.whatNotToDo: Do not leave bulky items on the curb without arranging for proper collection. Avoid illegal dumping.
guideLines.safetyPrecautions: When handling bulky waste items such as furniture, appliances, and large toys, use proper lifting techniques to avoid back injuries. It's advisable to have assistance or use a trolley for moving heavy items. Wear protective footwear to prevent foot injuries and gloves for grip and protection from sharp edges.

whyItIsImportant.benefits: Proper disposal of bulky waste reduces landfill usage, promotes recycling, and contributes to a cleaner and safer environment.
whyItIsImportant.impact: Recycling bulky items helps in recovering valuable materials, reduces environmental impact, and supports sustainable waste management practices.

008.funFact: Furniture and other bulky items often end up in landfills, but if repurposed or recycled, a single sofa can save up to 9 cubic yards of landfill space, illustrating the significant impact of recycling and reusing bulky items.

009.name: Construction and Demolition Waste
009.description: Construction and Demolition Waste includes materials from the construction, renovation, and demolition of buildings and structures. Proper management is crucial to recycle materials and minimize environmental impact.

guideLines.recommendedBinType: Special Collection or Designated Dumping Areas
guideLines.handling: Check with local regulations for disposal. Some materials require special processing or handling.
guideLines.separation: Separate materials based on type (e.g., metal, wood, concrete) for efficient recycling.
guideLines.whatNotToDo: Do not mix C&D waste with regular household waste. Avoid illegal dumping and improper disposal.
guideLines.safetyPrecautions: Ensure wearing sturdy gloves and safety glasses to protect against sharp objects and debris in C&D waste like wood, metal, and concrete. Appropriate footwear is essential to prevent injuries from heavy materials. Use dust masks for protection against dust and fine particles. Employ proper lifting techniques for heavy items to avoid back injuries.

whyItIsImportant.benefits: Proper disposal promotes material recycling, reduces landfill use, and minimizes environmental pollution.
whyItIsImportant.impact: Recycling C&D materials conserves resources, supports the building industry with recycled materials, and contributes to sustainable development.

009.funFact: Recycling one ton of concrete can save up to 1,360 gallons of water and 900 kg of CO2, highlighting the significant environmental benefits of repurposing C&D materials instead of disposing of them in landfills.

010.name: Electronic Waste
010.description: Electronic Waste, or E-Waste, includes discarded electronic devices and equipment. Proper recycling and disposal are essential to recover valuable materials and prevent environmental contamination.

guideLines.recommendedBinType: Specialized E-Waste Collection Points or Recycling Centers
guideLines.handling: Handle E-Waste carefully to avoid breakage and leakage of hazardous substances. Follow local regulations for disposal.
guideLines.separation: Separate E-Waste from regular waste. Sort by type for efficient recycling.
guideLines.whatNotToDo: Do not dispose of E-Waste in regular trash. Avoid dismantling or breaking electronic devices, which can release toxic substances.
guideLines.safetyPrecautions: Use gloves to protect from sharp edges when handling E-Waste like old computers and TVs. Be aware of hazardous materials like lead and mercury in electronics. Avoid breaking them to prevent exposure. Recycle at designated centers for safe disposal.

whyItIsImportant.benefits: Proper disposal of E-Waste recycles valuable materials, reduces landfill use, and protects the environment from toxic substances.
whyItIsImportant.impact: Recycling E-Waste supports the circular economy, reduces the need for new raw materials, and minimizes ecological footprints.

010.funFact: Recycling one million laptops saves enough energy to power over 3,500 US homes for a year. Recycling a million cell phones can recover 35,274 pounds of copper, 772 pounds of silver, 75 pounds of gold, and 33 pounds of palladium.

011.name: Glass Waste
011.description: Glass Waste includes various types of discarded glass products. Recycling glass is crucial as it can be processed and remade into new glass products, reducing the need for new raw materials.

guideLines.recommendedBinType: Glass Recycling Bin or Drop-off Locations
guideLines.handling: Handle glass waste carefully to avoid injury. Remove any non-glass components if required.
guideLines.separation: Separate glass by color and type when possible to enhance recycling efficiency.
guideLines.whatNotToDo: Do not dispose of glass in regular waste bins. Avoid mixing glass with other recyclables that might contaminate it.
guideLines.safetyPrecautions: Use gloves when handling broken glass to prevent cuts. If dealing with a large quantity of glass waste, eye protection is recommended to guard against potential splinters or shards. Always lift heavy glass items properly to avoid injury. Keep glass waste in a rigid container to prevent breakage and ensure safe transportation.

whyItIsImportant.benefits: Recycling glass reduces landfill waste, conserves natural resources, and saves energy. Glass can be recycled indefinitely without loss of quality.
whyItIsImportant.impact: Effective glass recycling helps in reducing environmental impact, supports sustainable resource use, and contributes to a circular economy.

011.funFact: Recycling glass is incredibly efficient as it can be endlessly recycled without any loss in purity or quality. In fact, 80% of recovered glass containers are made into new glass bottles, and a glass container can go from a recycling bin to a store shelf in as little as 30 days.

012.name: Industrial Waste
012.description: Industrial Waste comprises a broad range of materials resulting from industrial and manufacturing processes. Proper management, including recycling and safe disposal, is vital to minimize environmental impact.

guideLines.recommendedBinType: Specialized Industrial Waste Containers or Recycling Facilities
guideLines.handling: Handle with appropriate safety gear, especially when dealing with hazardous materials. Follow all regulatory guidelines for disposal.
guideLines.separation: Separate waste by type (e.g., hazardous vs. non-hazardous) and material (e.g., metal, plastic) to facilitate recycling and disposal.
guideLines.whatNotToDo: Do not mix hazardous industrial waste with non-hazardous waste. Avoid illegal dumping or improper disposal of industrial waste.
guideLines.safetyPrecautions: Always use gloves, protective eye wear, and masks when handling industrial waste, especially if it contains hazardous materials.

whyItIsImportant.benefits: Proper handling and recycling of industrial waste conserves resources, reduces pollution, and supports sustainable industrial practices.
whyItIsImportant.impact: Effective management of industrial waste reduces the strain on landfills, minimizes environmental hazards, and contributes to the circular economy.

012.funFact: Recycling industrial metals can save up to 75% of the energy needed to produce them from raw materials.

013.name: Metal Waste
013.description: Metal Waste encompasses various discarded metal items and materials. It is highly recyclable and can be reprocessed into new metal products, reducing the need for virgin ore extraction.

guideLines.recommendedBinType: Metal Recycling Bin or Scrap Yard
guideLines.handling: Sort metals by type and remove any non-metal components if possible. Handle with care to avoid injury.
guideLines.separation: Separate ferrous metals (like steel and iron) from non-ferrous metals (like aluminum and copper) to enhance recycling efficiency.
guideLines.whatNotToDo: Do not dispose of metal waste with regular trash. Avoid mixing different types of metals unless instructed by your local recycling facility.
guideLines.safetyPrecautions: Wear gloves and protective footwear when handling metal waste to prevent cuts and injuries.

whyItIsImportant.benefits: Recycling metal saves energy, reduces greenhouse gas emissions, and conserves natural resources. Metals can be recycled multiple times without degrading their properties.
whyItIsImportant.impact: Effective metal recycling reduces environmental impact, decreases the demand for new mining, and supports sustainable resource management.

013.funFact: Recycling one aluminum can save enough energy to run a TV for three hours.

014.name: Paper Waste
014.description: Paper Waste encompasses various types of discarded paper and paper products. Recycling paper waste is crucial for reducing deforestation and conserving natural resources.

guideLines.recommendedBinType: Paper Recycling Bin
guideLines.handling: Remove any non-paper components like plastic liners, staples, or tape. Keep paper dry and clean for effective recycling.
guideLines.separation: Separate paper by type (e.g., cardboard, office paper) and condition (e.g., clean, soiled) to enhance recycling efficiency.
guideLines.whatNotToDo: Do not mix soiled or greasy paper waste with clean paper. Avoid disposing of recyclable paper in regular waste bins.
guideLines.safetyPrecautions: No specific safety precautions are necessary for handling most paper waste.

whyItIsImportant.benefits: Recycling paper reduces the need for new paper production, saving trees and decreasing energy and water consumption.
whyItIsImportant.impact: Effective paper recycling minimizes landfill use, reduces greenhouse gas emissions, and supports sustainable forestry practices.

014.funFact: Recycling a single ton of paper can save 17 trees and 7,000 gallons of water.

015.name: Plastic Waste
015.description: Plastic Waste comprises a variety of discarded plastic items. Given its long decomposition time, recycling and proper disposal of plastic waste are essential to mitigate environmental impact.

guideLines.recommendedBinType: Plastic Recycling Bin or Facility
guideLines.handling: Clean and dry plastics before recycling. Remove any non-plastic components, such as labels or caps.
guideLines.separation: Separate plastics by type and category, as different types of plastics have different recycling processes.
guideLines.whatNotToDo: Do not mix plastic waste with other recyclables or general waste. Avoid throwing large plastic items in regular trash bins.
guideLines.safetyPrecautions: No specific safety precautions are necessary for handling most plastic waste.

whyItIsImportant.benefits: Recycling plastic reduces the need for new plastic production, conserves resources, and decreases pollution. It also helps reduce the amount of plastic entering landfills and oceans.
whyItIsImportant.impact: Effective plastic recycling contributes to environmental sustainability, reduces greenhouse gas emissions, and supports waste management efficiency.

015.funFact: Recycling one ton of plastic can save up to 7.4 cubic yards of landfill space.

016.name: Rubber Waste
016.description: Rubber Waste consists of various discarded rubber products. Recycling rubber is important for conserving resources and reducing environmental impact, as rubber can take a long time to decompose in landfills.

guideLines.recommendedBinType: Specialized Rubber Recycling Facility or Collection Points
guideLines.handling: Handle rubber waste carefully, especially when dealing with large or heavy items. Ensure proper storage to prevent environmental contamination.
guideLines.separation: Separate different types of rubber waste for effective recycling. Remove any non-rubber components if possible.
guideLines.whatNotToDo: Do not dispose of rubber waste in regular trash bins. Avoid burning rubber waste, as it releases harmful toxins.
guideLines.safetyPrecautions: Wear gloves and protective clothing when handling rubber waste to avoid potential skin irritation.

whyItIsImportant.benefits: Recycling rubber helps in reducing landfill waste and pollution. It can be repurposed into various products like rubber mulch, mats, and asphalt additives.
whyItIsImportant.impact: Effective management of rubber waste supports environmental sustainability and helps conserve non-renewable resources used in rubber production.

016.funFact: Recycled rubber from tires can be used to create artificial turf, playground surfaces, and even as a fuel source in some industrial processes.

017.name: Textile Waste
017.description: Textile Waste consists of discarded fabric and clothing materials. It's a significant component of environmental waste. Recycling and repurposing textile waste are essential for reducing its impact on the environment.

guideLines.recommendedBinType: Textile Recycling Bin or Donation Centers
guideLines.handling: Clean and dry textiles before recycling. Damaged or worn textiles can be repurposed or recycled into new products.
guideLines.separation: Separate textiles by type (e.g., cotton, polyester) and condition (e.g., wearable, non-wearable) for more efficient recycling or repurposing.
guideLines.whatNotToDo: Do not throw away wearable textiles with regular trash. Avoid disposing of heavily soiled or contaminated textiles without proper treatment.
guideLines.safetyPrecautions: No specific safety precautions are necessary for handling most textile waste.

whyItIsImportant.benefits: Recycling textiles conserves resources, reduces landfill waste, and decreases the demand for new raw materials. Repurposed textiles can find new life in various applications.
whyItIsImportant.impact: Effective textile waste management supports sustainable fashion, reduces environmental pollution, and promotes a circular economy in the textile industry.

017.funFact: Recycling or repurposing just one ton of textiles can prevent the emission of approximately 7 tons of CO2.

018.name: Wood Waste
018.description: Wood Waste includes various discarded wood products and materials. It is crucial to recycle and repurpose wood waste to reduce deforestation and manage waste sustainably.

guideLines.recommendedBinType: Wood Recycling Facility or Specialized Collection Points
guideLines.handling: Handle wood waste carefully to avoid splinters and injuries. Remove any non-wood components like nails or screws.
guideLines.separation: Separate treated wood from untreated wood as they require different recycling processes. Sort based on type and size for efficient recycling.
guideLines.whatNotToDo: Do not dispose of wood waste with regular trash, especially if it's treated with chemicals. Avoid burning treated wood due to toxic fume emission.
guideLines.safetyPrecautions: Wear gloves and protective eye wear when handling wood waste to prevent injuries from splinters and sharp edges.

whyItIsImportant.benefits: Recycling wood waste reduces landfill usage, conserves natural resources, and supports sustainable forestry practices.
whyItIsImportant.impact: Effective wood waste management decreases environmental pollution and provides valuable resources for reuse in construction and manufacturing.

018.funFact: Recycling just one ton of wood waste can save the equivalent of 1,000 gallons of gasoline in energy value.

019.name: Hazardous Waste
019.description: Hazardous Waste includes a variety of materials that pose significant risks to health and the environment. Proper handling, storage, and disposal are essential to mitigate these risks.

guideLines.recommendedBinType: Specialized Hazardous Waste Collection Facilities
guideLines.handling: Handle with extreme care using appropriate safety gear. Follow all local and federal regulations for storage and disposal.
guideLines.separation: Separate different types of hazardous wastes as they require unique handling and disposal methods.
guideLines.whatNotToDo: Do not dispose of hazardous waste in regular trash bins or sewers. Avoid any unauthorized dumping.
guideLines.safetyPrecautions: Always wear protective gear, including gloves, goggles, and masks, when handling hazardous materials. Ensure proper ventilation and avoid direct contact.

whyItIsImportant.benefits: Proper management of hazardous waste prevents environmental contamination, protects public health, and ensures compliance with legal standards.
whyItIsImportant.impact: Careful disposal of hazardous materials reduces the risk of soil and water pollution and supports a safer, cleaner environment.

019.funFact: The proper disposal of a single quart of motor oil can prevent up to two million gallons of drinking water from becoming contaminated.

020.name: Chemical Waste
020.description: Chemical Waste includes various hazardous and non-biodegradable chemicals that can pose significant risks to health and the environment. Proper handling, storage, and disposal are crucial for minimizing these risks.

guideLines.recommendedBinType: Specialized Chemical Waste Collection Facilities
guideLines.handling: Handle with extreme caution using appropriate safety gear. Follow all regulatory guidelines for storage, transport, and disposal.
guideLines.separation: Separate incompatible chemicals and categorize them based on hazard class (e.g., flammable, corrosive, toxic).
guideLines.whatNotToDo: Do not dispose of chemical waste in regular trash bins, down drains, or in natural water bodies. Avoid mixing different chemicals which could react dangerously.
guideLines.safetyPrecautions: Always wear protective gear, including gloves, goggles, and appropriate respiratory protection. Ensure proper ventilation when handling volatile or fumigant chemicals.

whyItIsImportant.benefits: Proper disposal of chemical waste prevents environmental pollution, conserves resources, and reduces health hazards.
whyItIsImportant.impact: Managing chemical waste responsibly minimizes the risk of soil and water contamination and contributes to a safer ecological system.

020.funFact: Properly recycling just one gallon of used motor oil can produce enough energy to power the average home for a year.

021.name: Medical Waste
021.description: Medical Waste comprises various items used in healthcare facilities that are potentially infectious or hazardous. Proper disposal is critical to prevent the spread of diseases and protect public health.

guideLines.recommendedBinType: Specialized Medical Waste Disposal Containers
guideLines.handling: Handle with extreme caution and use appropriate protective gear. Medical waste should be segregated at the point of generation.
guideLines.separation: Separate sharps, pharmaceutical, pathological, and chemical wastes as each type requires different disposal methods.
guideLines.whatNotToDo: Do not dispose of medical waste in regular trash bins or mix with general waste. Avoid handling without proper protective equipment.
guideLines.safetyPrecautions: Always use gloves, masks, and potentially face shields or gowns when handling medical waste to minimize exposure risk.

whyItIsImportant.benefits: Proper disposal of medical waste reduces the risk of infection transmission, protects healthcare workers and the public, and complies with health regulations.
whyItIsImportant.impact: Effective management of medical waste is crucial for maintaining a safe and healthy environment, especially in healthcare settings.

021.funFact: A typical hospital generates about 33 pounds of medical waste per bed per day, highlighting the importance of efficient waste management in healthcare facilities.

022.name: Oil Waste
022.description: Oil Waste includes various types of used and contaminated oils, which require special handling for recycling and disposal to prevent environmental contamination and health risks.

guideLines.recommendedBinType: Designated Oil Recycling Facility or Collection Points
guideLines.handling: Store oil waste in leak-proof containers. Avoid direct contact and inhalation of fumes.
guideLines.separation: Separate different types of oils and oil-related waste for proper recycling and disposal.
guideLines.whatNotToDo: Do not dispose of oil waste in regular trash, down the drain, or in water bodies. Avoid mixing oil waste with other hazardous materials.
guideLines.safetyPrecautions: Use gloves and eye protection when handling oil waste. Ensure proper ventilation in storage areas.

whyItIsImportant.benefits: Recycling oil waste conserves natural resources, prevents pollution, and supports environmental sustainability. Properly recycled oil can be refined into new products.
whyItIsImportant.impact: Effective oil waste management reduces the risk of soil and water contamination and helps in maintaining a clean and safe environment.

022.funFact: One gallon of used motor oil can contaminate one million gallons of fresh water.

023.name: Radioactive Waste
023.description: Radioactive Waste includes materials and objects with radioactive substances. Its hazardous nature necessitates strict handling, storage, and disposal protocols.

guideLines.recommendedBinType: Specialized Radioactive Waste Facilities
guideLines.handling: Strict safety protocols required. Handling by trained professionals only.
guideLines.separation: Based on radioactivity type and level for proper disposal.
guideLines.whatNotToDo: No disposal in regular trash. No direct contact without protection.
guideLines.safetyPrecautions: Specialized protective gear and radiation detectors mandatory.

whyItIsImportant.benefits: Protects from harmful radiation, prevents environmental contamination.
whyItIsImportant.impact: Essential for public health and safety, prevents long-term environmental damage.

023.funFact: Some radioactive waste can remain hazardous for millennia.

024.name: Sanitary Waste
024.description: Sanitary Waste includes various personal hygiene products that are used and discarded. Due to potential health risks, particularly in medical or care facilities, proper disposal is essential to prevent contamination.

guideLines.recommendedBinType: Specialized Sanitary Waste Disposal Units
guideLines.handling: Handle with care, ideally with gloves, to prevent direct contact and contamination.
guideLines.separation: Separate sanitary waste from regular waste for specialized disposal.
guideLines.whatNotToDo: Do not flush sanitary waste down toilets. Avoid disposing of in regular trash bins without proper containment.
guideLines.safetyPrecautions: Wear gloves when handling and disposing of sanitary waste. Ensure proper hygiene practices post-disposal.

whyItIsImportant.benefits: Proper disposal prevents the spread of infections and maintains hygiene in public and private spaces.
whyItIsImportant.impact: Effective management of sanitary waste is crucial for public health, especially in densely populated or sensitive areas like hospitals.

024.funFact: The average person generates about 30 pounds of sanitary waste per year.

025.name: Sewage Waste
025.description: Sewage Waste encompasses waste water and materials that are flushed or drained from households, industrial establishments, and agricultural lands. Proper treatment and disposal are crucial for environmental protection and preventing water contamination.

guideLines.recommendedBinType: Specialized Sewage Treatment Facilities
guideLines.handling: Avoid direct contact and follow safety protocols for handling sewage.
guideLines.separation: Ensure separation from potable water sources and adherence to waste water treatment processes.
guideLines.whatNotToDo: Do not release untreated sewage into natural water bodies or the environment.
guideLines.safetyPrecautions: Wear protective gear, including gloves and masks, and practice good hygiene after handling sewage waste.

whyItIsImportant.benefits: Proper sewage management prevents disease transmission, protects water sources, and supports public health.
whyItIsImportant.impact: Effective sewage waste treatment is essential for environmental conservation and sustainable urban development.

025.funFact: Advanced sewage treatment plants can convert waste into energy and reusable water, demonstrating the potential for resource recovery from waste.

026.name: Landfill Waste
026.description: Landfill Waste includes materials that are not recyclable or compostable. It encompasses a range of non-recyclable items that end up in landfills, leading to potential environmental concerns like soil and groundwater contamination.

guideLines.recommendedBinType: General Waste Bins or Dumpsters, labeled for non-recyclable items
guideLines.handling: Carefully handle landfill waste, segregating it from recyclable and hazardous materials.
guideLines.separation: Important to separate from recyclables, organics, and hazardous waste to minimize landfill impact.
guideLines.whatNotToDo: Avoid disposing of recyclable or compostable items as landfill waste.
guideLines.safetyPrecautions: Wear gloves and use appropriate lifting techniques when handling landfill waste to avoid injury and ensure proper hygiene.

whyItIsImportant.benefits: Proper disposal in landfills helps manage non-recyclable waste, reducing environmental pollution.
whyItIsImportant.impact: Minimizing landfill waste is critical for sustainable waste management, preventing long-term environmental damage.

026.funFact: Efforts to reduce landfill waste can significantly lower greenhouse gas emissions, underscoring the importance of recycling and waste reduction.

common.searchPlaceholder: ابحث عن عنصر لإعادة التدوير أو التخلص منه
common.disclaimer: المعلومات المقدمة هنا عامة وقد لا تنطبق على جميع المناطق أو الظروف. يجب استشارة اللوائح والإرشادات المحلية لإدارة النفايات العضوية.
common.readMoreSearch: حلول إدارة {{value}} المحلية وكيفية التعامل معها
